history.content:
I would say physics 7B is probably the most important class, not because you necessarily need a ton of E&M, but more for physical intuition (how to look at EM fields). 16B helps with phasors and understanding how to use complex exponentials and frequency responses to model light. I didn't think 53 was useful.

If you think you have good physical intuition, be it from AP physics or 7B, and you took 16B, you'll probably be fine.

I tried searching this piazza for an answer but I couldn't find one, also couldn't find a past website for the course. The course listing on the EECS website says the prerequisites are Math 53 and EE16A+B/Math 54; but the HKN course page says 16A+B and recommends Physics 7B also, not 53, though. I plan to take 16B but I'm not sure whether I should take Math 53 or not as well before taking the course, since I just wanted an intro into optics before I dive deeply and take a bunch of courses I otherwise wouldn't take (mostly interested in SWE, never planned to take 53, just curious about optics). Would the class be terribly difficult without 53/Physics 7B, and is there some material I should review should I decide not to take them? Could someone who has taken the course give some insight about what mathematical knowledge is absolutely necessary?
history.subject: Prerequisites for EE 118
